Comments_List: Percussion techniques.
I improved my technical ability on the bassoon and learned more about making bassoon reeds.  I also developed a deeper sense of musicality and learned how to effectively prepare for a solo recital.
Conservatory-style work on vocal technique.
A deeper insight into vocal production and critical inquiry into my habits and hurdles with proper technique.
Keeping calm during performances, musicality (deep tone, breathing)
Jazz Theory
Got better at singing
I greatly improved my vocal technique and knowledge of classical vocal repertoire.
Improvement in vocal technique and being on stage as an actor

I learned how to voice Bach on marimba with the Cello Suite No. 1. I learned about how to play different movements of a suite written in the 16-1700s. I was able to integrate dynamics and articulation of my playing with the theory of the music.
Violin technique, musicality and performance skills.
Private vocal lessons
I developed insights in solo violin performance.

Strengths: High quality instruction from best marimba player in the world. 
Weaknesses: Instruction is not regularly scheduled.
This is an excellent course; I cannot think of any ways to improve it.

The lessons are less-structured, which can be helpful to lighten course load, but sometimes becomes a bit of let down when communication and consistency falls short. I learned a lot, but feel I could have gotten more with more consistent work.
Personal attention and complete focus on my habits, technique, and pitfalls. Perfect!
Russell was a great instructor. Sometimes difficult to work around both of our busy schedules
It's good

It does not seem fair that the students of Janna Baty do not have to perform a final jury. I feel that preparing 3 pieces for a jury performance was an important part of my lessons curriculum, and needing to memorize three pieces and perform them in an audition-like setting was extremely instructive. This style of preparing pieces and performing them is necessary for any performer looking to audition for graduate schools or jobs in the future, and I think Jannas students are deprived of this educational opportunity.
The grad student, Jisu Jung, was fantastic in explaining how to create a more mature sound from the marimba.
Weekly lessons were very helpful. Studio classes are a great way to work on performing and get feedback.
I really enjoy my lessons.
Yes. Lessons are good for you.
Yes, do it. Lessons for credit are amazing.
Yes; I would highly recommend this course to anyone who wants to develop as a soloist and who wants regular close engagement with music.
I'd recommend lessons to any student looking to improve their technical skills as a musician, especially those interested in performing professionally.

Absolutely! Lessons are so incredibly helpful to improving not only your musical ability but also your character and ability as a human to change, improve, and become flexible. This has been a really wonderful journey for me in improving my vocal abilities and an interesting exploration into how a lot of my character traits interact with my musical abilities/production.
Yes, Russell was a great teacher and super friendly.
Yeah it's good take it get better at music
Absolutely! If you are serious about improving vocal technique, I would highly recommend lessons for credit.
Yes! Its for anyone who seriously wants to improve on an instrument or on their voice.
I would recommend this course to another student looking to improve in their skills on their instrument. It was well taught and I learned a lot that I can extend to other instruments as well.
I would recommend lessons to anyone interested in furthering their development in solo performance of an instrument.
This totally depends on who you would be taking lessons with, but I had a fantastic time taking lessons during my time at Yale.
